notesStmt.note: Old repairs. Dirty of carbon from degraded ink.
Two anonymous notes of previous owners, folio 32v, the second dated 1920 (1609).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Pentatuech with vowel-points and accents, masorah magna and parva. Sefer ha-tigan is prefixed.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 to 12 leaves each.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square and semi-cursive script, punctuated, of the 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: Psalm 99 written in an ornamental design.
Parts of masorah magna written in the outer margin in a number of short lines, forming a series of ornamental angles.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Pentateuch. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1379.'

history.provenance: Aharon ben Avi Shelomoh ben Yosef ha-Kohen al-ʿIrāqi
